result.execSummary:
The defendant Justin J Johnson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Methamphetamine, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(g).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Must report to Probation today by 12:00 pm (7/25/22).

miscConds.notes: $300.05 fine/costs to be paid to the Clerk of Court's Office within 60 days or set up payment plan. Failure to pay may result in a tax intercept, license suspension, warrant and/or civil judgment subject to collection efforts.

$250.00 DNA surcharge to be paid to the Clerk of Court's Office within 60 days or set up payment plan. Failure to pay may result in a tax intercept, license suspension, warrant and/or civil judgment subject to collection efforts.
Must complete an AODA assessment and comply with recommendations.

Not to have contact with known users/dealers except as necessary for treatment or in a confinement setting. 

Cannot vote until civil rights restored, cannot hold elected office, other civil rights may be lost until restored. If not a US citizen, may face deportation or loss of other citizenship rights.
May not possess or use firearms and, if considered a violent felony, no body armor.

Must provide a DNA sample.  Under Wisconsin Statute 165.76, you are required to provide a biological specimen to the Wisconsin Department of Justice for deoxyribonucleic acid (DNA) testing.  If you fail to provide a DNA sample, you may be held in contempt and subject to sanctions or charged with a new crime.

timeConds.notes:
Stayed for use by Probation if necessary.
*Per Court Order on 10/20/22, 44 days of jail time is to be released and served. Start date as determined by the Department of Corrections.

DNA Submission Acknowledgment Form

9:06 am Assistant District Attorney Benjamin James Webster in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Justin J Johnson in court.  Attorney Donna Burger in court for Justin J Johnson. CH-Clerk Both parties are in agreement with resolution. Count 1 - Amended - w/out repeater, Count 2 - DRI. DE - Justin Johnson, sworn. DE plea - Guilty. CT. goes over plea questionnaire and max penalties. Cannot vote until civil rights restored, cannot hold elected office, other civil rights may be lost until restored. If not a US citizen, may face deportation or loss of other citizenship rights. May not possess or use firearms and, if considered a violent felony, no body armor.
CT. finds DE FKI&V enters plea, accepts guilty plea, adj. - guilty. 

State requests court follows joint recommendation. Atty Donna Burger - arguments.  DE makes statement. 

SENTENCE: 
Count 1 - Possession of meth - w/out repeater: W/H, 2 years probation, 1 year conditional jail - stayed, for use by probation agent when necessary, AODA and comply, no contact with known drug users except in a treatment setting, $550.05 fine/costs which includes DNA SC, DNA sample, $500.00 cash bond to be applied to fines/costs, must report to probation before 12:00 pm today, 58 days credit. 

Count 2 - Possession of drug para. - DRI. PCR. 9:36 am adj.
Plea/sentencing hearing on July 25, 2022 at 09:00 am.

2:35 pm Defendant Justin J Johnson appeared by video, in custody from Pepin County Jail.  Attorney Donna Burger in court for Justin J Johnson.  Attorney David Stilin in court for State of Wisconsin. CH-Clerk Both parties agree to reschedule plea/sentencing. DE states he is due to be released from Pepin County in July. Ct. matter to be set for further proceedings in July. 2:39 pm adj.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 25, 2022 at 09:00 am.
